feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 5:07AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS DEVELOPING WITH SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... A series of strong storm systems moving into the Bering Sea will bring a prolonged period of strong east to southeast winds to much of Bristol Bay and the Kuskokwim Delta between Monday and Wednesday morning. Areas of light snow will spread northward with

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued December 31 at 4:58AM AKST until January 04 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...St Lawrence Island. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Thursday afternoon.

entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Southeast winds 35 to 55 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Eastern Aleutians. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Tuesday evening.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 9:48PM AKST until January 02 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. Visibility reduced to one-half mile at times. * WHERE...Central Aleutians.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 1:49PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds And Blowing Snow Monday Through Wednesday... A series of storm systems moving into the southern Bering Sea will bring strong east winds along with blowing snow and reduced visibility to the West Coast through much of the early to middle part of next week. entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued December 29 at 8:09AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PM-2.5 HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR SANTA CRUZ COUNTY INCLUDING NOGALES SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 9:11AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: Light freezing rain is expected this morning in the valleys of the Northeast Mountains and the Northern Panhandle. Walking surfaces may become slick and patchy black ice on road surfaces will be possible. Areas that may see slick conditions this morning include the Pend Oreille River Valley, Highway 2 around Diamond Lake to Sandpoint, and Highway 95 from Athol to the Canadian border. Use

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 10:34AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: A Period of Snow Expected Late This Afternoon and Evening... Snow is expected most likely between 3 PM and 8 PM this afternoon into this evening. Accumulations around an inch to perhaps two inches are expected during this time for elevations above 2500 feet with temperatures around 30 to 32 degrees. The ridges along Interstate 68 will be impacted by the snowfall and surfaces may
